dismissalText.commentary: Wessly Madhevere run out (sub [Taijul Islam]/Mehidy Hasan Miraz) 19 (27b 2x4 0x6 53m) SR: 70.37

dismissalComment.html: down the track and flicked to on side.. oh what has happened there? Both the batters jog through for a single and saw a slight fumble in the deep and Kaia decides to pinch an extra run. Madhevere  had no clue whatsoever and responds to the call. Fielder rockets to the bowlers end and he was not even in the picture.  NEVER RUN ON A FUMBLE

commentTextItems.html: short and it's all over! What a shot and what a game! Pulled over deep midwicket for a huge six. Lets out a big roar

commentPostTextItems.html: So that is it from here, I'll take leave and take care and good bye.

Regis Chakabva : Obviously made it's really good to get a first win like that. But I think you know whole credit to Raza and Innocent, the way they went about after we lost a few early wickets and we get it was really important to for them to kick on the way they did and you know, we couldn't have asked for anything better. I thought we did very well in that first 20 overs, we didn't get wickets but they also didn't get away from us. So we're quite happy with where we were, we let it go a little bit in the middle but we came back strong and then you know, and I thought they were probably 20 or 30 short so we're quite happy with three and by that point. it was amazing, we couldn't have asked for anything better we spoke you know, over lunch about how we needed somebody to bat long get 100 and then get two hundreds you know we couldn't have asked for anything better. It will be nice obviously try and get off to a better start with a bat but otherwise in all in all, you know if we can keep on getting those sort of performances, if we don't get back up again I think we'll be going well.

Sikandar Raza - Player of the match: I thought innocent was brilliant out there. I thought that partnership where we always speak about when you chasing 300 or runs if you get a partnership of 180 and plus it wins you game. I think all of us have done that. Sean Williams was there. I think Craig's done that Reggie has been doing that as well. All the senior boys are trying their hardest to be example for those youngsters and then have a change. You don't have a culture where youngsters can come and flourish. So all the senior boys are doing well. At one point I thought you know thought of us that slightly staying behind the game. So all I was trying to focus on is to to back him and to tell him that if we stay here we win this game together, to try and calm him down and try and encourage him to play good cricketing shots instead of just just maybe trying to hit the ball too hard. So most of the chats that we had was pretty encouraging and trying to calm him down as soon as we stay in the hunt and inshallah we'll come out of the victorious

Tamim Iqbal: We knew the first 10 overs you probably have to bat like a test match where you try and survive. And because after 10th over wicket got really really good and as you see tremendous partnership. (on fielding) And we have been doing this for for a long time now regularly we've been dropping catches on someday that has that will cost us and today was the day. (On Injuries) That doesn't help either. So we have I think Litton is out of the series. Honestly, this is what I've heard and need to check up on others.
Azeez: "One of the finest 2nd innings century we've seen in recent times!!!"
MuZo: "what a match, what a player, what an allrounder Sikandar Raza is. Take a bow! "

Just wow! We saw everything in this game. Twin tons, fifties, players being stretchered out, injuries, drops, sixes, comebacks and 303 for the loss of just 2 wickets. Bangladesh started off effectively by taking 3 for 62 but it was Innocent Kaia and Sikandar Raza kept the score board ticking and got the boundaries when needed. They never let the required rate to slip over 8. Bangladesh bowlers seemed clueless. Bowlers did produced some chances but fielders failed to cash in.

commentImages.caption: Sikandar Raza finished the job with a six
commentImages.longCaption: Sikandar Raza finished the job with a six, Zimbabwe vs Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Harare, August 5, 2022

commentTextItems.html: off cutter, pushed to cover
short ball down leg, pull and miss
rubbing salt on injury here! Full and wide on off stump, caressed through the cover for four more
dropped.. story of the day so far. Short ball, goes for another pull, gets a top edge and Taskin at long-leg region shells a dolly
welcomes him with a sixer over deep midwicket.. Back of a length ball, hangs on the back foot and kaboom
quicker ball, pushed to long-on for a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Umanga: "Sikandar Raza has been class in this series but sadly he does not gets to play top nations..hoping he continues this form in India series and the tour of Australia..most pivotal player for Zimbabwe."

flatter and quicker, pushed down the ground
shade full on off, drives to deep cover for a single
low full toss on the pads, flicked away for a single

dismissalText.commentary: Wessly Madhevere run out (sub [Taijul Islam]/Mehidy Hasan Miraz) 19 (27b 2x4 0x6 53m) SR: 70.37

dismissalComment.html: down the track and flicked to on side.. oh what has happened there? Both the batters jog through for a single and saw a slight fumble in the deep and Kaia decides to pinch an extra run. Madhevere  had no clue whatsoever and responds to the call. Fielder rockets to the bowlers end and he was not even in the picture.  NEVER RUN ON A FUMBLE

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 51 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 9.4 overs (58 balls), Extras 6
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (Tamim Iqbal 31, Litton Das 14, Ex 6)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 162 runs, 1 wicket)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 78/0 in 17.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 42, Litton Das 29)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 79 balls (7 x 4)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 23.1 overs (139 balls), Extras 10
1st Wicket: 100 runs in 139 balls (Tamim Iqbal 53, Litton Das 37, Ex 10)
Litton Das: 50 off 75 balls (4 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 30.6 overs (186 balls), Extras 11
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (Litton Das 33, Anamul Haque 17, Ex 0)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 171/1 in 33.1 overs (Anamul Haque 17)
Litton Das retired hurt at 171/1 (81, 33.1 overs)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 37.6 overs (228 balls), Extras 12
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 90 runs, 1 wicket)
Anamul Haque: 50 off 47 balls (4 x 4, 2 x 6)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (Anamul Haque 33, Mushfiqur Rahim 17, Ex 1)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 43.6 overs (264 balls), Extras 12
Bangladesh: 300 runs in 49.4 overs (298 balls), Extras 15
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 48 balls (5 x 4)
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 303/2 in 50.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 52, Mahmudullah 20)
Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 48 runs, 2 wickets)
Anamul Haque kept in place of Mushfiqur Rahim from the start of Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 194 runs, 1 wicket)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 10.5 overs (65 balls), Extras 6
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 64 balls (I Kaia 25, W Madhevere 19, Ex 6)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 64/3 in 15.0 overs (I Kaia 32, Sikandar Raza 1)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 20.2 overs (122 balls), Extras 6
I Kaia: 50 off 66 balls (7 x 4)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 56 balls (I Kaia 19, Sikandar Raza 31, Ex 1)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 145/3 in 30.0 overs (I Kaia 65, Sikandar Raza 47)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 30.2 overs (182 balls), Extras 8
Sikandar Raza: 50 off 57 balls (1 x 4, 3 x 6)
4th Wicket: 100 runs in 112 balls (I Kaia 37, Sikandar Raza 63, Ex 2)
Zimbabwe: 200 runs in 35.4 overs (214 balls), Extras 8
4th Wicket: 150 runs in 143 balls (I Kaia 65, Sikandar Raza 82, Ex 3)
I Kaia: 100 off 115 balls (11 x 4, 1 x 6)
Sikandar Raza: 100 off 81 balls (8 x 4, 4 x 6)
Zimbabwe: 250 runs in 41.1 overs (247 balls), Extras 11
Zimbabwe: 300 runs in 47.4 overs (286 balls), Extras 12

stories.title: Tamim: 'Poor catching had to cost us at some point, today was the day'

stories.summary: Four dropped catches and sloppy ground-fielding hurt Bangladesh in the first ODI against Zimbabwe; it's been an issue for long, says their captain

stories.summary: All the stats highlights from the first ODI in Harare

image.caption: Innocent Kaia and Sikandar Raza added 192 for the fourth wicket
image.longCaption: Innocent Kaia and Sikandar Raza added 192 for the fourth wicket, Zimbabwe vs Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Harare, August 5, 2022

stories.title: Litton Das a doubt for Asia Cup after picking up hamstring injury
stories.seoTitle: ZIM vs BAN 2022 - 1st ODI - Bangladesh's Litton Das ruled out for a month due to hamstring injury, in doubt for Asia Cup
stories.summary: Nurul Hasan, Mustafizur Rahman also sidelined with injuries; Bangladesh call up Mohammad Naim and Ebadot Hossain as replacements

image.caption: Litton Das was stretchered off due to a hamstring injury
image.longCaption: Litton Das was stretchered off due to a hamstring injury, Zimbabwe vs Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Harare, August 5, 2022

stories.title: Tamim becomes first Bangladesh batter to reach 8000 ODI runs
stories.seoTitle: ZIM vs BAN - 1st ODI - 2022 - Tamim Iqbal becomes first Bangladesh batter to reach 8000 ODI runs
stories.summary: He reached the landmark during the first ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal plays powerfully to the off side
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal plays powerfully to the off side, Bangladesh vs Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Dhaka, May 23, 2021

recentReportStory.title: Raza and Kaia's record-breaking hundreds sink Bangladesh
recentReportStory.seoTitle: ZIM vs BAN, 1st ODI, 2022 - Sikandar Raza and Innocent Kaia record-breaking hundreds sink Bangladesh
recentReportStory.summary: Zimbabwe chased down a target of 304 with ease and ended a 19-match losing streak in ODIs against this opposition

image.caption: Innocent Kaia and Sikandar Raza during their record partnership
image.longCaption: Innocent Kaia and Sikandar Raza during their record partnership, Zimbabwe vs Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Harare, August 5, 2022

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84

recentPreviewStory.title: Zimbabwe riding high after T20 triumph but reinforced Bangladesh a fresh challenge
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Zim vs Ban ODI series - Zimbabwe riding high after T20 triumph but reinforced Bangladesh a fresh challenge
recentPreviewStory.summary: The hosts will also be without a raft of familiar faces as they look to snap a 19-ODI losing streak against their visitors

image.caption: Ryan Burl propelled Zimbabwe with a half-century that included a 34-run over
image.longCaption: Ryan Burl propelled Zimbabwe with a half-century that included a 34-run over, Zimbabwe vs Bangladesh, 3rd T20I, Harare, August 2, 2022

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
